summary.p1: I am a software developer with a diverse background in space, math, electronics and web. The common thread in my life has been a passion for progress and discovery which has driven my career, my skills and a love of language and travel.
summary.p2: I am excited to work with an innovative company in Munich where I can continue to contribute and grow, both technically and culturally.

education.thesis: Modular Power System Design for BRRISON
education.honors: Graduated Magna Cum Laude, With Honors, GPA 3.833/4.000

degrees.title: Masters of Science
degrees.subject: Aerospace Engineering - Astrodynamics and Spacecraft Nav.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.summary: I am the lead developer for Cascadence, a cloud platform for deploying machine learning predictions in industrial applications.
points: Designing web services using FastAPI, PostreSQL, NumPy and Pandas to ingest, process and store data.
Collaborating with data scientists to deploy scikit-learn and Keras models to AWS using Docker, ECS and Lambda.
Building React and Angular 2 applications with rich data visualization and dashboards to show model predictions.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.summary: Developed web apps and database structures for the Hospital Billing application of Epic’s electronic medical record software.
points: Transitioned a core billing app to Epic’s .NET web framework, fully rewriting the data model and back-end logic in C#.
Reimagined the VB front-end using Javascript, improving aesthetics and adding asynchronous loading.
Managed hierarchical database schemas and used the Caché scripting language to develop APIs.

jobs.title: Research Engineer - Software and Electronics
jobs.summary: Consulted on commercial prototypes, doing up-front analysis followed by design, CAD and firmware for electronics.
points: Built test rigs for sensors and mechanisms, and applied results to system design using Python/NumPy and LabVIEW.
Created a PCB to condition automotive power, read analog engine sensors and drive a motor and valves in response.
Implemented a 32-bit AVR running C for sensing, actuator control, USB comm and an LED-based UI for truck drivers.

jobs.title: Graduate Student - System Design Lead and Electrical Engineer
jobs.summary: Led the engineering team for DayStar, a sub-arcsecond star tracker flown on NASA's $1.5M BRRISON balloon mission.
points: Built a spectral performance model in MATLAB which drove optics, video processing and custom CMOS camera design.
Created a PCB stack in Altium to power an ATX motherboard, science cameras, a steering mirror, mechanisms and heaters.
Analyzed flight test video using NumPy to prove star finding capability and calculate subarcsecond tracking accuracy.
